title.value: GAME THEORETICAL ANALYSIS OF KIDNEY EXCHANGE PROGRAMS
title.justification: This is the main title on the first page of the paper
title.quote: GAME THEORETICAL ANALYSIS OF KIDNEY EXCHANGE PROGRAMS

extractions.description: This paper examines the application of game theory to kidney exchange programs (KEPs). It focuses on modeling KEPs as non-cooperative games to understand the behavior of different entities involved, such as hospitals or regions. The paper generalizes existing two-player models to N-player scenarios and evaluates the impact of quality information on game outcomes. The analysis includes computational experiments using data from the Canada Kidney Paired Donation Program.

type.justification: The paper proposes theoretical models and analyzes their properties through computational experiments.
type.quote: We recover from [29] the 2-player game setting considering L = 2 and generalize their positive theoretical results for any finite number of players...

name.justification: The primary research field is stated as applying game theory to kidney exchange programs.
name.quote: A game theory setting can suitably frame the agentsâ€™ incentives.

name.justification: The paper uses operations research techniques, such as optimization and mathematical modeling, to address problems in kidney exchange programs.
name.quote: There is an extensive literature formulating the problem of selecting the optimal set of exchanges in a KEP with integer programming models and developing techniques to solve them efficiently.

name.justification: The paper applies computational and data-driven approaches to a healthcare problem, specifically kidney exchange.
name.quote: the Canadian Kidney Paired Donation Program; this complex optimization problem in healthcare involves modeling patient and donor characteristics and compatibility.
